@HeidiBriones @phunk2243 These simplistic view is pretty much useless if you don't normalize for most other parameters. You an rather measure transmission empirically in a lab...
@HeidiBriones It's a size cut-off. It's about droplets size. So, they won't stop neither of these. Just decrease the level of spread around your head...
@phunk2243 @HeidiBriones They are not really filtering anyways but it seems efficiency is pretty good if all participants wear one. Ofc, it would be also influenced by other factors.

@HeidiBriones Could be anyone. Ideally you (or whoever) wears an FFP2 mask but an 'ordinary' surgical mask would be good enough if everyone wears one indoors. The first 'increase' your odds of not getting contaminated, the second the odds of not contaminating someone.
@HeidiBriones You only wear surgical masks and replace/recycle them on daily basis.

I find it fascinating that 8 months ago, those were 3-4 random people making a PFP project and today it's a ~20-25 of them working full time on it and growing...

@0xinc Possibly. I don't know really. I think the token itself creates more its own problems - balancing the in-game 'tokenomics' but not sure if it adds any technical issue around the game itself. The game relies on 'market trades of items etc', and adds utility for the cats...

@0xinc What I would have done differently is let people pay their transactions and no bother with that. Perhaps facilitate the whole gaming?! Txs on Polygon are cents so no need to be 'extra kind' and make these 'free' especially if that creates technical issues...

@0xinc Nothing wrong really. The ideas are good, the execution less so BUT no one has done or is doing anything remotely close from the PFP-based projects, at least to my knowledge. It would take ~a month to adjust to all variables, many of which are infrastructure related.
